multicast
Class MulticastLayer

java.lang.Object
  multicast.MulticastLayer

public class MulticastLayer
extends Object

This class implements the sending and receiving logic for the multicast layer. It is the core of the reliable multicast layer.

Author:
parth

Method Detail

getDeviceID

public String getDeviceID()
returns the mac address of the interface on which it is listening.

Returns:
mac address in a string

sendAll

public void sendAll(String Message)
public method to send a "Message" to all the devices that are to be addressed by the same receive message by them implementing an onReceive method. This is a non blocking call and spawns a new thread to send a message each time it is called.

Parameters:
Message - this is the message string to be sent to all other instances of the object on other devices

addEventListener

public void addEventListener(MulticastReceive listener)
This method is called when a class implements the onReceive interface and and wants a call back on the onReceive function. The call on the onReceive function is implemented as an event listner and this method adds the class to the list of listners.

Parameters:
listener - This has to be an instance of a class that implements the MulticastReceive interface.

removeEventListener

public void removeEventListener(MulticastReceive listener)
This method is alost never called. When a class implements the onReceive interface and wants to remove the event listner this method is useful.

Parameters:
listener -

getCurrentEnvironmentNetworkIp

public String getCurrentEnvironmentNetworkIp()
this method give the ip address of the given interface on which the multicast layer object is listening on

Returns:
the IP address in a string format
